get.description: Get a paginated list of authors with their activity metrics and reputation

external_id.description: The author's ID from your system

profile_picture.description: URL of the author's profile picture

external_link.description: URL of the author's external profile

manual.description: True if the trust level was set manually by a moderator

block.description: Block or suspension details, if applicable. Null if the author is enabled.

until.description: The timestamp until which they are blocked if the author is suspended.

reason.description: The moderators reason why the author was blocked or suspended.

risk_level.description: Calculated risk level based on more than 10 behavioral signals.

average_sentiment.description: Average sentiment score of content (-1 to 1). Requires a sentiment model in your project.

metadata.description: Additional metadata provided by your system. We recommend including any relevant information that may assist in the moderation process.

email_verified.description: Whether the author's email is verified

phone_verified.description: Whether the author's phone number is verified

identity_verified.description: Whether the author's identity is verified

is_paying_customer.description: Whether the author is a paying customer

post.description: Create a new author. Typically not needed as authors are created automatically when content is moderated.

profile_picture.description: URL of the author's profile picture

external_link.description: URL of the author's external profile

get.description: Get detailed statistics about a moderation queue including review times, action counts, and trends

schema.description: Number of days to analyze statistics for

averageTimeToReview.description: Average time in milliseconds to review an item

totalPending.description: Total number of items pending review

count.description: Number of times this action was taken

percentageOfTotal.description: Percentage this action represents of all actions

topReviewers.description: List of top reviewers and their statistics

accuracyScore.description: Optional accuracy score based on review quality metrics

topActions.description: Most common actions taken by this reviewer

actionId.description: Most used action by this reviewer

actionName.description: Name of the most used action

count.description: Number of times this action was used
Number of reviews on this date

trend.description: Trend indicator (-1 to 1) showing if this type of flagged content is increasing or decreasing

get.description: Get paginated list of items in a moderation queue with filtering options

flagged.description: Whether this label caused a flag

actions.description: Action IDs taken on this item

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp of when the action was taken

flagged.description: Whether the item is flagged by any label

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp of when the item was created

post.description: Mark a queue item as resolved with a specific moderation action

resolvedAt.description: Timestamp when the item was resolved

post.description: Mark a previously resolved queue item as unresolved/pending

comment.description: Optional reason for unresolving the item

unresolvedAt.description: Timestamp when the item was unresolved

get.description: List all available moderation actions for the authenticated organization.

schema.description: List of moderation actions with their associated webhooks

key.description: User defined key of the action.

createdAt.description: The date the action was created.

builtIn.description: Whether the action is a built-in action or a custom one.

queueBehaviour.description: Whether the action resolves and removes the item, unresolves and re-add it to the queue, or does not change the resolve status.

filterInQueueIds.description: The IDs of the queues the action is available in.

position.description: Show the action in all queues, selected queues or no queues (to use via API only).

possibleValues.description: The possible values of the action. The user will be prompted to select one of these values when executing the action.

valueRequired.description: Whether the action requires a value to be executed.

freeText.description: Whether the action allows any text to be entered as a value or if it must be one of the possible values.

name.description: The webhook's name, used to identify it in the dashboard

url.description: The webhook's URL. We'll call this URL when the event occurs.

moderationActionId.description: The ID of the moderation action to trigger the webhook on. Only used for moderation action webhooks.

post.description: Execute a moderation action on one or more content items.

actionKey.description: ID or key of the action to execute

contentIds.description: IDs of the content items to apply the action to. Provide this or authorIds.

authorIds.description: IDs of the authors to apply the action to. Provide this or contentIds.

value.description: Optional value to provide with the action

queueId.description: Optional queue ID if the action is queue-specific

duration.description: Optional duration in milliseconds for actions with timeouts

success.description: Whether the action was executed successfully

post.description: Execute an action on a set of content items in a queue.

parameters.name: actionId

schema.description: The ID or key of the action to execute.

parameters.description: The ID or key of the action to execute.

contentIds.description: The IDs of the content items to perform the action on.

authorIds.description: IDs of the authors to apply the action to

queueId.description: The ID of the queue the action was performed from if any.

value.description: The value of the action. Useful to set a reason for the action etc.

ids.description: The IDs of the content items.

post.description: (Deprecated use https://api.moderationapi.com/v1/moderate) Analyze text content with your configured moderation models and filters.

contentId.description: The unique ID of the content in your database.

value.description: The text you'd like to analyze. We recommend to submit plain text or HTML

doNotStore.description: Do not store the content. The content won't enter the review queue

contextId.description: For example the ID of a chat room or a post

metadata.description: Any metadata you want to store with the content

schema.description: Moderation analysis results including model outputs and detected patterns

status.description: Success if the request was successful

error.description: Error message if the request failed

contentId.description: The ID of the content. Only returned if the content was stored.

quota_usage.description: The quota usage of the request

flagged.description: Whether the content was flagged by any models

author.description: The author of the content if your account has authors enabled. Requires you to send authorId when submitting content.

external_id.description: The author's ID from your system

block.description: Block or suspension details, if applicable. Null if the author is enabled.

until.description: The timestamp until which they are blocked if the author is suspended.

reason.description: The moderators reason why the author was blocked or suspended.

manual.description: True if the trust level was set manually by a moderator

content_moderated.description: Whether the content was moderated or not. Same as `content` !== `original`

unicode_spoofing.description: Whether the content is using look-alike characters. Often used by spammers.

data_found.description: Whether any entity matchers found data for the content

content.description: The content after moderation. With all mask replacements applied and look-alike characters replaced with the original characters.

nsfw.description: The NSFW model output if enabled in your project. Read more at https://docs.moderationapi.com/models/nsfw

error.description: Indicates an error with the model

warning.description: Indicates a warning from the model, e.g. if the text is too short or long and the model might not be accurate

SENSITIVE.description: Mentions religion, politics, race, etc., but is neutral or positive.

UNSAFE.description: Sexual, hateful, profane, and inappropriate content.

toxicity.description: The toxicity model output if enabled in your project. Read more at https://docs.moderationapi.com/models/toxicity

error.description: Indicates an error with the model

warning.description: Indicates a warning from the model, e.g. if the text is too short or long and the model might not be accurate

PROFANITY.description: Swearing, curse words, and other obscene language.

DISCRIMINATION.description: Discrimination of race, religion, gender, etc.

INSULT.description: Negative comments about looks or personality etc.

THREAT.description: Content containing intention to harm or violence.

quality.description: The spam model output if enabled in your project. Read more at https://docs.moderationapi.com/models/spam

error.description: Indicates an error with the model

warning.description: Indicates a warning from the model, e.g. if the text is too short or long and the model might not be accurate

sentiment.description: The sentiment model output if enabled in your project. Read more at https://docs.moderationapi.com/models/sentiment

error.description: Indicates an error with the model

warning.description: Indicates a warning from the model, e.g. if the text is too short or long and the model might not be accurate

propriety.description: The propriety model output if enabled in your project. Read more at https://docs.moderationapi.com/models/propriety

error.description: Indicates an error with the model

warning.description: Indicates a warning from the model, e.g. if the text is too short or long and the model might not be accurate

FLIRTATION.description: Pickup lines, compliments on appearance, etc.

SEXUALLY_EXPLICIT.description: References to sexual acts, body parts, etc.

matches.description: The matches of the entity matcher.

metaType.description: The meta type of content being moderated

conversationId.description: For example the ID of a chat room or a post

metadata.description: Any metadata you want to store with the content

doNotStore.description: Do not store the content. The content won't enter the review queue

id.description: The unique identifier for the content. Either the contentId provided by you or an autogenerated ID.

masked.description: Whether any values have been masked.

url.description: A public URL of the image content
A public URL of the video content
The URL of the audio content

author.description: The author of the content if your account has authors enabled. Requires you to send authorId when submitting content.

external_id.description: The author's ID from your system

block.description: Block or suspension details, if applicable. Null if the author is enabled.

until.description: The timestamp until which they are blocked if the author is suspended.

reason.description: The moderators reason why the author was blocked or suspended.

manual.description: True if the trust level was set manually by a moderator

evaluation.description: The evaluation of the content after running the channel policies.

flagged.description: Whether the content was flagged by any policy.

flag_probability.description: The probability that the content should be flagged.

severity_score.description: The severity score of the content. A higher score indicates more severe content.

unicode_spoofed.description: Whether the content was flagged for Unicode spoofing.

recommendation.description: The recommendation for the content based on the evaluation.

action.description: The action to take based on the recommendation

reason_codes.description: The reason code for the recommendation. Can be used to display a reason to the user.

policies.description: Results of all policies in the channel. Sorted by highest probability.

id.description: The unique identifier for the classifier output.

flagged_fields.description: The keys of the flagged fields if submitting an object.

insights.description: Results of all insights enabled in the channel.

channel_key.description: The unique key of the channel where the content was handled. Either the channel provided by you or automatically routed.

issues.description: An array of issues that were responsible for the error
An array of issues that were responsible for the error
An array of issues that were responsible for the error
An array of issues that were responsible for the error
An array of issues that were responsible for the error

error.CONFLICT.title: Action with this key already exists error (409)

example.message: Action with this key already exists

message.example: Action with this key already exists

issues.description: An array of issues that were responsible for the error
